title: Family tribute to boy killed when Topshop display barrier 'fell on him' | Metro News
text:
Jen Mills for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 4:45 pm Kaden Reddick suffered severe head injuries (Picture: INS) 
The family of 10-year-old Kaden Reddick, the boy who died in a ‘horrific accident’ at Topshop, described how his death will ‘leave a huge empty hole’ in their lives. 
Kaden, from Reading, suffered serious head injuries in an incident involving a display at the shop in town’s Oracle shopping centre on Monday afternoon. Pictured: Kaden Reddick, 10, who died when a Topshop display ‘fell on him’ 
Topshop has since recalled all display stands at tills ‘as a safety precaution’ with ‘immediate effect’. 
In a statement, Kaden’s family described him as an ‘adventurous’ and ‘creative boy’ who wanted to become a teacher. 
‘Kaden was a loving, cheeky, energetic boy whose death will leave a huge empty hole in the lives of everybody that knew him. Our house feels empty without him,’ they said. 
‘Kaden loved family holidays, with swimming being his favourite pastime. Kaden was ten (Picture: INS) 
‘He was always the first one in any pool or the sea. It didn’t matter how cold it was, he would jump in, trying to get everyone to join him. Boy, 10, killed when heavy piece of furniture ‘fell on him’ in Topshop 
‘Kaden was a very creative boy, who loved school.’ 
Bunches of flowers were left against the shop’s closed shutters yesterday with passers-by pausing to look at the tributes. 
One card, which was unsigned, read: ‘RIP little man.’ 
Topshop said the company has been left ‘deeply saddened’ after the ‘horrific accident’. 
An employee said orders had gone out ‘company wide’ to remove the till displays. Police outside Topshop in the Oracle shopping centre yesterday (Picture: PA) 
In a statement Topshop said: ‘The Topshop board together with thousands of staff are deeply saddened by the horrific accident that occurred in our Reading store yesterday afternoon. 
‘All our thoughts are very much with the family at this difficult time. 
‘We are thoroughly investigating all the events surrounding this extremely sad situation.’ More
